artifacts.name: Benkei's Collection of 999 Swords
artifacts.description: A collection of 999 swords taken from warriors defeated by Benkei at Gojo Bridge. Each weapon represents a victory and contributes to Benkei's fearsome reputation as 'The Giant of Gojo Bridge.'

physical_properties.composition: Various swords of different makes and qualities
physical_properties.appearance: Diverse collection of blades, some likely ornate, others simple but functional
physical_properties.condition: Varied - some might be damaged from the duels in which they were claimed

significance.historical: Tangible evidence of Benkei's martial prowess and the many duels fought at Gojo Bridge
significance.personal: Represents Benkei's quest and purpose, possibly filling some deeper void
significance.narrative: Sets up the significance of the 1000th sword (Yoshi's) as a milestone and turning point
significance.cultural: Reflects the warrior tradition of collecting trophies from defeated opponents

history.creation: Accumulated over months of duels at Gojo Bridge

notable_events.description: The completion of the collection up to 999 swords

cultural_context.symbolism: Represents martial achievement and dominance in warrior culture
cultural_context.traditions: Collection of defeated opponents' weapons is a recognized practice in samurai tradition

related_artifacts.description: Yoshi's sword, which Benkei sought to claim as his 1000th trophy
